intro: Hieracium coniatum, commonly known as the Alpine Hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy basal rosettes. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer, and the plant is known for its ability to colonize disturbed or open habitats. Hieracium coniatum is also notable for its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
